text: the project to create vessel is really
about taking a hundred and fifty four
flights of stairs and bolting them
together
so it was made in Venice in this
phenomenal shipyard there where the
steel work is exceptional so it's like
this complex jigsaw puzzle of major
steel pieces and they had to be
offloaded from the big ship and then
they're offloaded onto barges and then
were offloaded onto a low loader long
lorries being able to find the pieces of
road and bridge that could take the
weight of the steel was a big main
challenge and and I found it funny that
to get something all the way from Italy
to the Manhattan it wasn't the problem
it was getting it from Manhattan to
Manhattan the idea for the vessel came
from feeling that we shouldn't just make
a sculpture or a monument it felt to us
that rather than building a sculpture it
would be great if something was creating
more public space vessel that we are
building now has a linear mile of public
space but instead of in on one plane it
wraps its way up and around it's about
using your body you can't really
experience it without walking sixteen
stories
